page.title: 18Tregadillett Chapel
page.content: The present Methodist chapel was built in 1873 to replace the nearby small cob building that was becoming too small for the congregation.This then became a day school in oppositon to the Church of England School in the village.(There were frequent fights between the boys of the two schools.The Church school boys were known as Greyhounds and the chapel boys as Spaniels.)The change in attitude and religious practice can be seen when it is known that in 1873 there were 45-50 chapel members and a Sunday School of 35-40.At that time there were only 14 houses in the village,plus the neighbouring farms.Today the population of Tregadillett is approx.1000 and the chapel membership is 40-45 and a Sunday School of 25-30 but this is a joint Sunday School with the C.of E.
